Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Codicil \Cod"i*cil\, n. [L. codicillus, dim. of codex: cf. F. codicille. See {Code}.] (Law) A clause added to a will. [1913 Webster]
codicil n : a supplement to a will; a testamentary instrument intended to alter an already executed will
